New Records: Golden State improved to 4-1 at home and 8-0 when scoring 120-plus points.Golden State leads West Group C with a 2-0 record in Emirates NBA Cup Group Play.Golden State has now started 10-2 or better six times since the 2014-15 season.Golden State’s reserves lead the NBA in scoring at 58.8 points per game.Golden State won their fifth-straight home game vs. the Grizzlies.Golden State improved to 8-0 when dishing out 30-plus assists.Golden State improved to 6-0 when grabbing 50-or-more rebounds.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry made a game-winning three-pointer with 1.1 second left in the first half.Buddy Hield made a 28-foot three-pointer with 1:58 left in the third quarter.Lindy Waters III suffered a left knee hyperextension and did not return.Brandin Podziemski made a behind-the-back pass to Jonathan Kuminga for a two-hand slam.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors had six players in double figures, paced by Buddy Hield's 18 points.The Warriors outscored the Grizzlies by 36 points from behind the arc.Golden State Warriors' shooting advantage was the key factor in their win.Lindy Waters III started in place of injured guard De'Anthony Melton.
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors improved to 4-1 in clutch games this season.Golden State is now 8-0 when scoring 120-plus points.The Warriors have now started 10-2 or better six times since the 2014-15 season.Golden State’s reserves lead the NBA in scoring at 58.8 points per game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Golden State won the team’s fourth consecutive game at Chase Center.The Warriors are now 8-1 vs. teams from the Western Conference.Tonight marked the third-straight victory overall.The Warriors have now started 10-2 or better six times since the 2014-15 season.Golden State’s reserves lead the NBA in scoring at 58.8 points per game.Golden State’s bench has scored 40-or-more points in 11 of their first 12 games.
